attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table provides the ground-truth evidence for each report generation event.
Use it to investigate specific activities, verify which user generated a report at a precise time, and confirm the outcome.
It is essential for drilling down from a trend chart or conducting a spot-check on a specific day's reporting activity.

**How:** Sort by any column to organize the data.
For instance, sort by 'user.name' to see all reports generated by a specific person or service account.
Filter by 'event.outcome:failure' to quickly identify and investigate any issues with the reporting system.
This table is critical for confirming that reports are being generated by the correct, authorized personnel or roles as defined in your organization's policy.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"query":"(event.category:iam AND event.type:access AND event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download*)) AND (kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *state* OR *compliance* OR *audit* OR *vulnerability*) OR process.args:(*--output* OR *--format*report* OR *--export*))","language":"kuery"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-000279] Detailed Report Generation Events

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This chart provides a quick overview of which users or service accounts are generating reports.
It is useful for verifying that only authorized personnel are performing reporting functions.
Use this as a high-level check to spot unauthorized activity or to confirm that automated reporting accounts are functioning as expected.

**How:** Review the chart to ensure all users listed are authorized to generate reports.
An unexpected name in this list warrants immediate investigation. Click on any slice to filter the entire dashboard for that specific user, allowing for a deeper analysis of all reports they have generated.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"query":"(event.category:iam AND event.type:access AND event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download*)) AND (kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *state* OR *compliance* OR *audit* OR *vulnerability*) OR process.args:(*--output* OR *--format*report* OR *--export*))","language":"kuery"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-000279] Reports Generated by User

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** Use this trend chart to visually verify that security reports are being generated consistently over time.
A flat line or significant gaps may indicate a failure in the reporting process, violating the 'organization-defined frequency' requirement.
Review this chart periodically (e.g., weekly, monthly) to match the observed generation frequency against the required schedule for key security reports.

**How:** Hover over the chart to see report counts for specific time intervals.
Use the time picker to analyze specific periods (e.g., the last 30 days).
The chart is broken down by report name, allowing you to filter for a single, critical report to analyze its specific trend.

query.query: (event.category:iam AND event.type:access AND event.action:(*report* OR *export* OR *download*)) AND (kibana.report.name:(*security* OR *state* OR *compliance* OR *audit* OR *vulnerability*) OR process.args:(*--output* OR *--format*report* OR *--export*))

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-000279] Security Report Generation Trend

attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-000279, focusing on the timely generation and delivery of security-related information. This visualization displays the health status of security report generation based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'user.name: <user_name>' to focus on a specific system or user. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score (e.g., 75 or above) indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline and warrants immediate investigation, as it could signify issues with report availability or unauthorized attempts to suppress reporting.

attributes.description:
**Why this visualization works:** This visualization displays the maximum anomaly score over time for the job monitoring security report generation events. It helps detect unusual behavior that might indicate issues with the timely generation of security-related information, such as a sudden drop in reports or an unexpected spike. 

**How an analyst can use it:** Look for spikes in the anomaly score. A high score indicates a significant deviation from normal activity. Use the time selector to isolate these periods and investigate the underlying causes. This can help identify potential failures in automated reporting or unauthorized attempts to interfere with report generation.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-000279] ML - Report Generation Anomaly Trend (converted)
